summary: This is an email chain from January 26, 2021, discussing whether FBI agents obtained Bureau of Prisons (BOP) inmate calls or emails for Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence clarifies that no such calls were obtained for Maxwell's case, as there was no subpoena. It also includes a procedural note about checking lists from BOP Intelligence Officers for other investigations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the inquiry, specifically whether jail calls or emails were obtained for her as part of the investigation.

events.title: Email Inquiry Regarding Maxwell's Jail Calls
events.description: An email chain within the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI confirms that jail calls and emails for Ghislaine Maxwell were not obtained from the Bureau of Prisons, as there was no subpoena for them.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI confirmed they had not obtained jail calls or emails for Ghislaine Maxwell from the Bureau of Prisons.
The reason given for not obtaining the calls was the lack of a subpoena for them.
The email discusses a procedural method where FBI agents can obtain BOP inmate communications directly from a BOP Intelligence Officer embedded at the JTTF.
The correspondence is dated January 26, 2021, while Maxwell was in custody awaiting trial.
